legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: The more difficulties there are, the greater the need for us to forge a closer bond between our peoples and to open our hearts to each other, and more people need to speak up for the relationship. We should build more bridges and pave more roads for people-to-people interactions.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: It is the reaching out to each other by our peoples that has time and again brought China-U.S. relations from a low ebb back onto the right track. I am convinced that once opened, the door of China-U.S. relations cannot be shut again.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: Despite our two countries’ different histories, cultures, social systems and development paths, both our peoples are kind, friendly, hardworking and down-to-earth. We both love our countries, our families and our lives and we both are friendly toward and interested in each other.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: President Xi recalled his first visit to the U.S. “I stayed at the Dvorchaks in Iowa.” He still remembers their address -- 2911 Bonnie Drive. “That was my first face-to-face contact with the Americans. The days I spent with them are unforgettable. For me, they represent America.”

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

media.ext_alt_text:
Upper pic: The Flying Tigers who helped China fight Japanese aggression during WWII, 1943
Lower pic: The Flying Tigers veterans and their descendants at the Badaling Great Wall in Beijing, 2023

Upper pic: The Flying Tigers who helped China fight Japanese aggression during WWII, 1943
Lower pic: The Flying Tigers veterans and their descendants at the Badaling Great Wall in Beijing, 2023

legacy.full_text: During WWII, our two countries fought side by side for peace and justice. We Chinese will never forget the Flying Tigers. The American people still remember the Chinese who risked lives to save American pilots. https://t.co/KoHkCI4tHX

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text:
The foundation of China-U.S. relations was laid by our peoples.
The door of China-U.S. relations was opened by our peoples.
The stories of China-U.S. relations are written by our peoples.
The future of China-U.S. relations will be created by our peoples. https://t.co/MvpBNor7hp

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: China and the U.S. have made many achievements -- US$760 bn of annual bilateral trade and over US$260 bn of two-way investment, 284 pairs of sister provinces/states and sister cities, and over 300 scheduled flights every week and over 5 mn travels every year at peak time. https://t.co/ySnN50Zeh5

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

media.ext_alt_text: File photo of Xi Jinping visiting San Francisco taken in front of the Golden Gate Bridge in 1985.
File photo of Xi Jinping visiting San Francisco taken in front of the Golden Gate Bridge in 1985.

legacy.full_text: At the welcome dinner by friendly organizations in the U.S., President Xi noted that his first visit to the U.S. in 1985 started from San Francisco, which formed his first impression of this country. Today he still keeps a photo of him in front of the Golden Gate Bridge. https://t.co/R6vpjg9hhA

legacy.full_text: 🇨🇳Chinese Hongqi and 🇺🇸American Cadillac Beast https://t.co/KzEE9VNJ5S

legacy.full_text: From #Bali to #SanFrancisco, the journey has not been easy. Let's build on #Bali and deliver #SanFrancisco vision. 🇨🇳🇺🇸 https://t.co/iJQrXE13du

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs,

File photo of Xi Jinping visiting San Francisco taken in front of the Golden Gate Bridge in 1985.

legacy.full_text: Pointing to a photo in his phone with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background, President Biden asked President Xi, “Do you know this young man?” “Oh yes,” said President Xi, “this was 38 years ago.”🌞 https://t.co/r65Em6Z7oS

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: They instructed their teams to build on the understandings reached in Bali and to timely follow up on and implement the new vision agreed at San Francisco. https://t.co/3EtQzikZ1i

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: Both agreed that their meeting was comprehensive and constructive. It has charted the course for improving and developing China-U.S. relations. And San Francisco should be a new starting point for stabilizing China-U.S. relations. https://t.co/x3uCI6aRBB

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs,

Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: They stressed the importance of all countries treating each other with respect and finding a way to live alongside each other peacefully, and of maintaining open lines of communication, preventing conflict, ...

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: ... upholding the UN Charter, cooperating on areas of shared interest, and responsibly managing competitive aspects of the relationship. The leaders welcomed continued discussions in this regard.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: The two presidents acknowledged the efforts of their respective teams to discuss the development of principles related to China-U.S. relations since the meeting in Bali. https://t.co/jqGCppp8ny

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: China’s development and growth, driven by its own inherent logic, will not be stopped by external forces.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: It is important that the U.S. side take China’s concerns seriously and adopt tangible steps to lift its unilateral sanctions so as to provide an equal, fair and nondiscriminatory environment for Chinese businesses.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: U.S. actions against China regarding export control, investment screening and unilateral sanctions seriously hurt China’s legitimate interests.

legacy.description:
Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs, 
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, 
Director General, Information Department, MFA PRC. 
Get to know us more @MFA_China
legacy.name: Hua Chunying 华春莹

legacy.full_text: Stifling China’s technological progress is nothing but a move to contain China’s high-quality development and deprive the Chinese people of their right to development.
